result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Pendleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Leon Pendleton was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leon Pendleton is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Leon Pendleton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 115 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with Ebony S., A.C.S., Lacheryl G and Cheryl G.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court waived all costs, surcharges and supervision fees except for the mandatory surcharges.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at $1857.72 payable to Ebony S.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 5/13/14 for Alexis S. for 1 appearance on 5/6/14; Lacheryl S., Ebony S., Cheryl G. for 2 appearances each on 5/5/14, 5/6/14.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  On the same day, at the hour of 1:35 pm the jury returned and by the foreperson brought in verdicts of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1 and 2 and GUILTY as to Count 3, which were read in open court.
The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Jury verdicts received and filed.  Jury discharged.
The Court granted defense motion for judgment on the verdicts and to Counts 1 and 2 and denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict as to Count 3 and ordered that judgments of acquittal as to Counts 1 and 2.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdict and ordered that a judgment of conviction be entered on the record as to Count 3.  Court dimissed the Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer and found the Repeater enhancer applies.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Out of the presence of the jury, state and defense rest.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Instructions reviewed by the parties.  Jury in box at 9:10 am.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:20 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies M. Tinsley and A. Cleveland who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury in the box at 1:50 pm.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Ebony S. Exhibit #14 received.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Margaret Kiefer.  Exhibit #'s 15,16,17,18,19 received.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the state:  Lacheryl S.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to testify or not testify and found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently agreed to testify. Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: A. S.  Exhibit #20 played for the jury.  Exhibit #20 received.  Jury out of the box.  Sidebar put on the record.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the defense:  Leon Pendleton.  Defense rests.  Jurors excused for the evening at 4:49 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Sidebars from previous day put on the record.  Jury in the box at 9:38 am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  A.S. Exhibit #'s 1,2,3,4,5,6 received.  Sworn for the state:  Ebony S.  Exhibit #'s 7,8,9,10,11,12,13 received.  Jury excused for lunch at 11:57 am.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE DALLET FOR JUDGE GRADY.
  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:20 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:38 pm.  Jury trial continued to 5/06/14 at 9:00 am.
Branch 23 in trial, Branch 40 - Judge Dallet agreed to hear Jury Trial on a spin from branch 23.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Leon Pendleton not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT Produced. 1st call, parties are ready to proceed to trail. Case passed to address court calendar.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Leon Pendleton not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 05/05/2014.
Received & Filed, State's Motion In Limine & State's Witness List.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motions In Limine, Defendant's Proposed List of Jury Instructions and Defendant's Witness List.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Leon Pendleton not in court, in custody.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel withdraws reqeust to argue bail.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Received & Filed, Certified Documents by the state. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Margaret Kiefer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense counsel requests bail review/scheduling date. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing date being set at 1:30 p.m. to accomadate court calendar.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ebony S., Lacheryl S. and ACS (DOB:  05/29/1997).

Defendant Leon Pendleton in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Leon Pendleton in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
